segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, so focused on drying her plate that she doesn't notice the water spilling over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost amusing how she stands there, completely unaware of the growing puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she ever looks around at the chaos happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming in through the window makes everything look so peaceful outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, it’s a completely different story—the children are up to something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing on that rickety stool, and I can feel my heart race just watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He seems so determined to get to that cookie jar, his little hand reaching in while the plate wobbles.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl beside him, eagerly anticipating her share, makes me chuckle despite the situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If the woman only looked over for a moment, she'd see how precarious this all is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but think about the trouble that might come if he falls—water everywhere and broken dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR
